messages: 6811f8ecdb76147cc7ceed5aa4fec0cc (16:18): hi, can Mozilla please tell Google not to be lame and treat Nightly 12.0 like an outdated browser? http://i.imgur.com/BN9SH.png
03cd618659ad3063c1d53077657a801c (16:19): 6811f8ecdb76147cc7ceed5aa4fec0cc: isn't that just Google having an ad for chrome
6811f8ecdb76147cc7ceed5aa4fec0cc (16:20): yeah, it's still pretty lame
03cd618659ad3063c1d53077657a801c (16:20): they are marketing Chrome in all possible ways
6811f8ecdb76147cc7ceed5aa4fec0cc (16:20): sorry, Chrome isn't faster than Firefox 12.0
6811f8ecdb76147cc7ceed5aa4fec0cc (16:21): also it wasn't there yesterday, it only started today
03cd618659ad3063c1d53077657a801c (16:21): mumbles something about monopoly in internet ads , and using wrong that monopoly ...
6811f8ecdb76147cc7ceed5aa4fec0cc (16:22): don't be evil? more like BE EVIL
03cd618659ad3063c1d53077657a801c (16:22): 6811f8ecdb76147cc7ceed5aa4fec0cc: interesting, that ad is also in google.fi
03cd618659ad3063c1d53077657a801c (16:22): apparently they have started some new campaign
90567b1e4960f50f5e604261cdc5a080 (16:23): also on google.de
6811f8ecdb76147cc7ceed5aa4fec0cc (16:23): also I saw this from Mozillazine, https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=720122
6811f8ecdb76147cc7ceed5aa4fec0cc (16:23): Google, terrible in all aspects
03cd618659ad3063c1d53077657a801c (16:24): well, Google search works ok, and Chrome is a good browser, but the company is behaving really badly nowadays
c94922b4c551bc6ffc44bcd518921215 (16:25): wonders what the reaction would be if Firefox started recommending bing with an overlay when users visited google.com
c94922b4c551bc6ffc44bcd518921215 (16:25): "Care about your privacy? Try bing!"
03cd618659ad3063c1d53077657a801c (16:25): I would be a bit surprised if EU or US won't do something to Google quite soon.
90567b1e4960f50f5e604261cdc5a080 (16:25): it's a matter of time I guess
6811f8ecdb76147cc7ceed5aa4fec0cc (16:27): nothing annoys me more than Google trying to tell me what browser I should use, same with MS
6811f8ecdb76147cc7ceed5aa4fec0cc (16:27): http://forums.mozillazine.org/viewtopic.php?f=37&t=2371583
6811f8ecdb76147cc7ceed5aa4fec0cc (16:28): MS telling Firefox users to move to IE9
6811f8ecdb76147cc7ceed5aa4fec0cc (16:28): both these companies need to be broken up
03cd618659ad3063c1d53077657a801c (16:29): well, in many ways MS is behaving a lot better in the web
03cd618659ad3063c1d53077657a801c (16:33): could we add some script to FF to automatically remove all the Chrome ads :)
6811f8ecdb76147cc7ceed5aa4fec0cc (16:37): thats pointless, they can change the ways to display the ad every time
6811f8ecdb76147cc7ceed5aa4fec0cc (16:37): someone really needs to call out Google on their bullshit
6811f8ecdb76147cc7ceed5aa4fec0cc (16:37): just like what http://blog.mocality.co.ke/2012/01/13/google-what-were-you-thinking/ did
827fac6a4d016d53b6874573cf37fc05 (16:37): ... since when are ads bullshit? Is directv ads telling you to switch to their network bullshit?
6811f8ecdb76147cc7ceed5aa4fec0cc (16:40): if they were targeting the ads to outdated browsers like IE6/7/8 it's fine
6811f8ecdb76147cc7ceed5aa4fec0cc (16:41): but targeting it to Firefox users is pretty much insidious and evil
